description: The Essex Kent Mennonite Historical Society (EKMHA) preserves and promotes the history of Mennonites in Essex and Kent Counties, Ontario. Based at the Mennonite Heritage Centre, it offers museum exhibits, archival collections, and educational programs that trace Mennonite heritage from 16th-century European settlements to modern communities.
Mennonites trace their history in Essex County to the foundation of Leamington United Mennonite Church in the 1920s.
Photo by Andrea_44 on Wikimedia Commons, licensed under CC BY 2.0.
